solution_line_template: She goes through {bottles_per_month} bottle a month and she likes to stock up for the entire year, which is {months_per_year} months so she needs {bottles_per_month}*{months_per_year} = <<{bottles_per_month}*{months_per_year}={total_bottles}>>{total_bottles} bottles
Each bottle is ${price_per_bottle} and she needs {total_bottles} bottles so they will cost {price_per_bottle}*{total_bottles} = $<<{price_per_bottle}*{total_bottles}={total_price}>>{total_price}

The website offers a {discount_percent_num}% discount off of her ${total_price} purchase so the discount will be {discount_percent_decimal}*{total_price} = $<<{discount_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{total_price}={discount_amount}>>{discount_amount}
Her sunscreen costs ${total_price} and her discount is {discount_amount} making her purchase total {total_price}-{discount_amount} = $<<{total_price}-{discount_amount}={final_cost}>>{final_cost}
